sen.j: 桂庵 玄樹（けいあん げんじゅ、1427年（応永34年）- 1508年6月28日（永正5年6月1日 (旧暦)））は、薩南学派を形成した臨済宗の僧侶。
sen.e: Genju KEIAN (1427-July 8, 1508) was a priest of the Rinzai sect of Buddhism in Japan, who formed the Satsunangaku school (school of Neo-Confucian in Satsuma).

sen.j: その後、豊後国万寿寺に赴いて学問を学び、1467年には明に渡海して蘇州市などを遊学する。
sen.e: After that, he went to Manju-ji Temple in Bungo Province for study, and in 1467, went across the sea to Ming to study in Suzhou City and other places.

sen.j: 1473年、日本に帰国したが、応仁の乱による戦禍から逃れるため、石見国に避難した。
sen.e: He came back to Japan in 1473, but escaped to Iwami Province to avoid ravages of the Onin War.

sen.j: 1478年、島津忠昌に招かれて大隅国正興寺、日向国竜源寺の住持となる。
sen.e: In 1478, he was invited by Tadamasa SHIMAZU to become a chief priest of Shoko-ji Temple in Osumi Province and Ryugen-ji Temple in Hyuga Province.

sen.e: Furthermore, he was invited by Tadakado SHIMAZU to lecture on Confucianism at Keiju-in Temple in Satsuma Province.

sen.j: また、伊地知重貞と『大学章句』を刊行（1481年）して宋学の普及に努めたことから、薩南学派の祖として名を成した。
sen.e: He became famous as the founder of the Satsunangaku school as he was committed to the propagation of Sogaku (Neo-Confucianism) by publishing "Daigaku shoku" with Shigesada IJICHI in 1481.

sen.j: 日本で初めて朱熹の『四書集註』を講義した岐陽方秀が施した訓点を玄樹が補正し、更にそれを文之玄昌が改訂したのが「文之点」である。
sen.e: Bunshi-ten' is guiding marks for rendering Chinese into Japanese, which were made by Kiyo Hoshu, who was the first in Japan to lecture on "Shisho Shicchu" by Chu His, and which were then corrected by Genju KEIAN and revised by Bunshi Gensho.

sen.j: 文之点は、近世、四書読解の主流となった。
sen.e: Bunshi-ten became the mainstream way of reading the Four Books of Confucianism in the early-modern times.

sen.e: Afterward, Genju KEIAN became a chief priest of Kennin-ji Temple and Nanzen-ji Temple, constructed Toki-an in Satsuma in 1502, and lived there.
